de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core

Class CodeSection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.CodeSection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CodeSection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Describes a section in examined software’s source code. Code sections may span multiple methods and types. They are defined by a start statement in one source code file and an end statement in another source code file that may or may not be the same as the first one. Code sections are immutable, meaning that once created, their attributes cannot be changed.

    A code section must describe a continuous part of source code, meaning that the last statement in the section will always be executed if the first one was executed, given that no Exceptions occur. All statements that may potentially be executed after the first statement but before the last one are considered to be in the section. A code section is considered to have been “completely executed” if the section’s first and last statement was executed. This does generally not mean that all statements in the section were executed.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CodeSection(java.io.File startFile, int startIndex, java.io.File endFile, int endIndex)
      Creates a code section that spans from the startIndexth statement in startFile to the endIndexth statement in endFile.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.File getEndFile()
      Gets the file that contains this section’s last statement.
      int getEndSectionIndex()
      Gets the index of the last statement in this code section.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeSection

        public CodeSection(java.io.File startFile,
                   int startIndex,
                   java.io.File endFile,
                   int endIndex)
        Creates a code section that spans from the startIndexth statement in startFile to the endIndexth statement in endFile.
        Parameters:
        startFile - The file containing this section’s first statement. Must not be null and startFile.isFile() must return true.
        startIndex - The index of the first statement in this section. Counting starts at 0.
        endFile - The file containing this section’s last statement. Must not be null and endFile.isFile() must return true.
        endIndex - The index of the last statement in this section. Counting starts at 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartFile

        public java.io.File getStartFile()
        Gets the file that contains this section’s first statement.
        Returns:
        The file containing this section’s first statement. Will never be null.

      • getStartSectionIndex

        public int getStartSectionIndex()
        Gets the index of the first statement in this code section. Counting starts at 0. The number thus describes how many statements precede the section’s first statement in the start source code file.
        Returns:
        The first statement’s index. A positive integer or 0.

      • getEndFile

        public java.io.File getEndFile()
        Gets the file that contains this section’s last statement.
        Returns:
        The file containing this section’s last statement. Will never be null.

      • getEndSectionIndex

        public int getEndSectionIndex()
        Gets the index of the last statement in this code section. Counting starts at 0. The number thus describes how many statements precede the section’s last statement in the end source code file.
        Returns:
        The last statement’s index. A positive integer or 0.
